page.title: 06POPULATION WEST LEOMINSTER
page.content: The population is highly concentrated in the two housing estates to the east of the area. These estates contain a wide cross-section ranging from the reasonably affluent to the very poor. On the private estate, most of the people are relative newcomers, coming mainly from the North of England. The population is also fairly mobile. The council estate tenants are mainly native to the area. A lot of people have moved here to live out their retirement in pleasant country surroundings. The remainder are mainly young families and single parents. Outside of these estates there are a couple of hamlets. These and other isolated farms are populated by farming families, many of whom have lived here all their lives.
